title: "The Symbolism of Distillation in Dante's Divine Comedy"
first_phrase: In the previous section, we explored the symbolism of distillation and how it relates to the attainment of enlightenment. In this concluding section, we delve into the practical application of this symbolism in the context of mastering the colors and symbols associated with each planet. These correspondences are crucial to gaining mastery over their respective energies and channeling them for personal growth. We also discuss the role of the sun as a key symbol in this practice and provide practical exercises for beginners.

Appoggi fisiologici per le dimensioni dei “pianeti” Per aiutarvi in questo tipo di pratica ad ogni simbolo abbiamo fatto corrispondere un colore così come un esercizio. Padroneggiare tali colori significa infatti padroneggiare la “signatura” corrispondente. A questo punto è possibile utilizzare tale forza in maniera utile per sé. L’uomo ed i pianeti 1 Sol – una chiave iniziale per questo simbolo è l’osservazione della luce diretta, e, per utilizzi più pratici, la luce di una lampadina. Gli indiani per uno scopo simile fanno osservare la fiamma di una candela.
last_phrase: In conclusion, the pursuit of reaching the ultimate goal of going beyond the mind and its fixations through the practice of mastering colors and their corresponding signatures is a path that requires both physiological and spiritual effort. Through the observation of the light and the use of the color yellow, we can awaken our spirit and enhance our body, achieving a state of concentration and individuation. So, let us master the power of colors and use it for our well-being.
